member.name: T:Alpaca.Markets.IntradayReporting
member.summary: Intraday reporting styles for portfolio history in the Alpaca REST API.

member.name: F:Alpaca.Markets.IntradayReporting.MarketHours
member.summary: Only timestamps for the core equity trading hours are returned (usually 9:30am to 4:00pm, trading days only).

member.name: F:Alpaca.Markets.IntradayReporting.ExtendedHours
member.summary: Returns timestamps for the whole session including extended hours (usually 4:00am to 8:00pm, trading days only).

member.name: F:Alpaca.Markets.IntradayReporting.Continuous
member.summary: Returns price data points 24/7 (for off-session times too). To calculate the equity values we are using the following prices: - Between 4:00am and 10:00pm on trading days the valuation will be calculated based on the last trade (extended hours and normal hours respectively). - After 10:00pm, until the next session open the equities will be valued at their official closing price on the primary exchange.

member.summary: An activity unique identifier from .

member.summary: The date on which the activity occurred or on which the transaction associated with the activity settled in the UTC.

member.summary: The net amount of money (positive or negative) associated with the activity.

member.summary: For dividend activities, the average amount paid per share. Not present for other activity types.

member.summary: The number of shares that contributed to the transaction (with the fractional part). Not present for all activity types.

member.summary: The cumulative quantity of shares involved in the execution (with the fractional part).

member.summary: For partially_filled orders, the quantity of shares that are left to be filled (with the fractional part).

member.summary: The cumulative quantity of shares involved in the execution (rounded to the nearest integer).

member.summary: For partially_filled orders, the quantity of shares that are left to be filled (rounded to the nearest integer).

member.name: T:Alpaca.Markets.OneCancelsOtherOrder
member.summary: OCO (One-Cancels-Other) is another type of advanced order type. This is a set of two orders with the same side (buy/buy or sell/sell) and currently only exit order is supported. In other words, this is the second part of the bracket orders where the entry order is already filled, and you can submit the take-profit and stop-loss in one order submission.
member.remarks: See Alpaca Order Documentation for more information.

member.name: T:Alpaca.Markets.StopLimitOrder
member.summary:
A stop-limit order is a conditional trade over a set time frame that combines the features of a stop order with those of a limit order and is used to mitigate risk. The stop-limit order will be executed at a specified limit price, or better, after a given stop price has been reached.
See https://alpaca.markets/docs/trading/orders/#stop-limit-order
